>So said jbase@... on 2003-05-31 --------------------
>
>I have used o=
ne time setup and teardown when testing tools that work on
>directories and=
 files.  I want a know set of directories and files (and
>for a backup tool=
 the dates).  

Why test that the file system works? Just verify that you g=
enerate the appropriate file and directory paths. The file system works.

>=
I don't see the value in setup/teardown for
>each unit test.

...then you'r=
e not doing TDD or Programmer Tests. That's not an accusation, but rather a=
n observation. Programmer Tests should be fast, independent and focus on lo=
gic rather than data. You're probably doing integration tests with data sou=
rces and front end applications, in which case you'd like to do setup and t=
eardown less often.

>I would like junit to support a onetime setup/teardow=
n for some types of
>tools, although it is possible I would get lazy and us=
e in when I
>shouldn't. 

JUnit supports one-time setup/teardown with TestS=
etup. What does "the tool" have to do with it?
